intro: Clintonia ophioglossoides, commonly known as the dwarf lily of the valley, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Melanthiaceae and is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and small, white, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded woodlands and has a rhizomatous root system that allows it to spread slowly. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and ecologically important component of forest understory communities.
